data.name: Website Audit Fixes
data.body: <p><strong>*PM Note: Open this task if the client has given approval for at least partial fixes if not all.*<br /><br />Goal:</strong> Fix all issues uncovered in the Technical Audit by the Frontend team to improve website search visibility.</p> <strong>Deliverable(s):</strong> <ol> <li>If no dev space exists, create one accordingly. <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#bookmark=id.hni6yo7fe1yx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Follow best practices from here</a>.</li> <li>Breakdown of which tasks have been completed and questions/comments on those skipped.</li> </ol> <strong>Checklist:</strong> <ol> <li>All points from website fixes have been responded to accordingly</li> </ol> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#heading=h.42if8ygppblz" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Frontend Developers Instructions &amp; Guidelines</a><br /><br /><strong>Please perform all fixes on dev site first, once approved by PM, we will push them live.</strong><br /><br />When the audit fixes go live, we should be checking to make sure everything is set up and working correctly on the live site by using the checklist below:<br /><br /> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <ol> <li>New website can be restored at anytime via the backup file.</li> <li>Website loads on the proper domain - including all its elements such as images, javascript, etc. Use checker tools and also navigate through the site as a user.</li> <li>All page redirects are properly configured &amp; working as per [Workbook: Redirects] including www/non-www [Workbook: Website Plan - Onsite SEO - URL]</li> <li>No 3xx/4xx links on the site</li> <li>No references to dev server (links, images, css, js)</li> <li>Make sure robots.txt isnt blocking crawlers</li> <li>Make sure pages arent noindex (if set via CMS)</li> <li>Contact form testing</li> <li>Advanced functionality/3rd party testing</li> <li>Enable cache and gzip</li> <li>Run page speed test to make sure it loads in &lt;2 seconds</li> <li>Make sure analytics are on all pages</li> <li><strong>implement redirects</strong></li> </ol>

data.name: WP Website Maintenance *O*
data.body: <p>Please log relevant maintenance updates and questions in this task.</p> <h2>Checklist On FED:</h2> <p>One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed. <a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.  <a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</p> </li> <li> <p>Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</p> </li> <li> <p>Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</p> </li> <li> <p>Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days. (NOTE : For websites using git, the backup plugin is not needed as we can use the git repo to restore the backups from the git version control.)</p> </li> </ol> <p> </p> <p>Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</p> </li> <li> <p>Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</p> </li> <li> <p>Security Check (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</p> </li> </ol> <p>It includes the frontend parts of the website:<br />- Visual appearance of the web pages</p> <p>- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen) </p> <p>- Browser compatibility:<br />On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari)<br />On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</p> <p>- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</p> <p>- Broken pages/ layouts </p> <p>- Formatting or alignment issues</p> <p><br />5. Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</p> <p> </p> <p>6. Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</p> <p> </p> <p>7. Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</p> <p> </p> <p>8. Database Cleanup (Monthly)</p> <p>a. Remove Unapproved comments</p> <p>b. Remove Trashed posts</p> <p>c. Remove Auto-draft posts</p> <p>d. Remove Spam Comments</p> <p>e. Delete Post Revisions</p> <p>f. Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</p> <p>g. Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks<br />h. Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata<br /><br /></p> <p>9. Test Products (WooCommerce sites only) (Monthly)</p> <ol> <li> <p>Create a test Product/Coupon</p> </li> <li> <p>Add product to cart functionality</p> </li> <li> <p>Update the cart functionality</p> </li> <li> <p>Proceed to the checkout page</p> </li> <li> <p>On the final Checkout page (Check if the website has any tax/shipping calculating options, and if so confirm it is working fine)</p> </li> <li> <p>Test all payment options</p> </li> </ol> <h2>On PM:</h2> <ol> <li> <p>Before opening this task, please fill in the proper GForm (i.e. (Re)Start, Website Launch, PM Transfer, etc.) that adds the relevant maintenance details to <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/2/d/19SDNRqoOmsifVDtslETR-M5l7HbCAjwRIJtkZ4i4yMo/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Website Maintenance Master Sheet</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> </ol>

Some pages don't exist yet, for those pages we should duplicate the layouts from existing pages (client shared that info with us in the table) and then later we will replace photos and text.</li> </ol> <p> </p> <p>Please see notes from the client here, additionally:</p> <div> <blockquote> <div>Here are the first changes for your team to make. Please reach out with any questions you have. The first changes are simply restructuring the Menu Bar, its drop-down menus, and the items that appear in those drop-downs. It also involves linking those drop-down items to the pages (templates) I wantsome of which are not the pages they currently link to.</div> <div> </div> <div>The UI changes are very minimal right now: renaming a new Menu Bar items and drop-down items, as well as getting rid of the little ^ that appears in the menu bar.</div> <div> </div> <div>These two documents should explain it clearly (I hope)!</div> </blockquote> </div> <p> </p> <p>If you guys have any questions let me know. Thank you!</p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clients live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clients CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Google Indexing
data.body: <p><strong>*PM Note: Open this task if you have access to the site and it has been submitted to Google Search Console.*<br /><br />Goal</strong>: Inbound Marketing Team to find out what pages on the site are listed on Google using relevant tools so that we can discover that they might not want to rank organically for some pages and vice-versa they might not rank for some pages that are currently hidden but shouldn't be.<br /><br />Please reference:<br /><a href="https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/7440203?hl=en" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Google Indexing Support</a><br /><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zU8jThOrWP5TyX0vbsDnnFad0BMLudtz4-Suy7BjiAs/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">SmartSites Indexing Guide</a><br /><br />Below is a brief recap on what we could check for &amp; do.<br /><br /><span><strong>Checklist</strong></span><br /><em><strong>Errors</strong></em><br /><strong>Server error</strong> = fix whatever is causing the server error or redirect URL<br /><strong>Redirect error</strong> = usually a loop. review and fix.<br /><strong>Submitted URL blocked by robots.txt = </strong>sitemap has a URL that is blocked via robots.txt. We should either remove the URL from the sitemap or edit the robots.txt so it's no longer blocked.<br /><strong>Submitted URL marked 'noindex'</strong> = sitemap has a URL that is marked as NOINDEX. We should either remove the URL from the sitemap or index it.<br /><strong>Submitted URL seems to be a Soft 404</strong> = sitemap has a URL that Google determined to be a 404 page but is returning a 200 status code. I'd check the page and make sure we get a 200 status code if it should be indexed, 404 if it shouldn't be.<br /><strong>Submitted URL returns unauthorized request (401)</strong> = sitemap has a URL Googlebot can't access this page because its not authorized. Either remove from the sitemap or fix the status code for Googlebot.<br /><strong>Submitted URL not found (404)</strong> = sitemap has a URL that returns 404 code. Either remove from the sitemap or make sure we return a 200 status code if we want it indexed.<br /><strong>Submitted URL has crawl issue</strong> = sitemap has a URL google can't figure out. Check the page for any potential issues. Lots of times broken javascript/HTML causing issues.<br /><br /><em><strong>Excluded</strong></em><br /><strong>Excluded by noindex tag</strong> = URL has a noindex tag and won't appear in search. Review and make sure that's what we actually want. If not, remove noindex.<br /><strong>Blocked by page removal tool = </strong>Page was submitted to be removed via GSC. This is usually done on purpose so we don't need to do anything but worth reviewing in case a mistake was made and we remove pages we didn't want to remove. (You can cancel a removal request in GSC)<br /><strong>Blocked by robots.txt = </strong>These URLs are blocked via robots.txt. Review to make sure we aren't blocking pages we want to be indexed.<br /><strong>Blocked due to unauthorized request (401) = </strong>Googlebot is unauthorized to view a URL - make sure that's correct behavior.<br /><strong>Crawl anomaly = </strong>Something weird happened, I usually submit for revalidation if the page looks fine when I visit.<br /><strong>Crawled - currently not indexed = </strong>Take a peek at the oldest URLs on the list and see if there is a reason they wouldn't be indexed. Usually just a temporary section for URLs but if URLs stay there for a long time, usually a sign of a bigger issue.<strong><br />Discovered - currently not indexed =</strong> nothing to do here<strong><br /></strong><strong>Alternate page with proper canonical tag = </strong>This URL has a canonical tag pointing to another page that is being indexed instead. Usually correct, nothing to do.<strong><br />Duplicate without user-selected canonical = </strong>2 pages is so similar that Google decided to only index one of them. Would require more analysis (either set a canonical or rewrite pages)<strong><br /></strong><strong>Duplicate, Google chose a different canonical than user = </strong>User set a canonical URL but Google ignored it and chose its own. Not ideal. Would review and adjust canonicals/content.<strong><br />Not found (404) = </strong>Usually want to redirect these pages to similar live pages.<strong><br /></strong><strong>Page removed because of legal complaint = </strong>Straightforward. I would let client know. Pretty sure you can dispute.<br /><strong>Page with redirect =</strong> Make sure these are pages we actually want to redirect - usually correct and nothing to do.<br /><strong>Soft 404 = </strong>Google found a page that it believes doesn't exist but the URL gives a 200 Found status. Review and either make it more unique or send 404 status code if we don't want the page to rank.<br /><strong>Duplicate, submitted URL not selected as canonical = </strong>Sitemap has a URL that Google is deciding not to index, and is instead using a canonical URL. Remove the URL from the sitemap or make more unique.<br /><br />The following URLs can be kept as no index:</p> <ol> <li>AMP mobile pages</li> <li>Blog paginated pages </li> <li>Feed pages </li> <li>.atom </li> <li>Product page with category slug (shopify ecommerce) </li> <li>Shopping carts Login pages </li> <li>Thank you pages </li> <li>Filter URLs</li> <li>Product variant URLs </li> <li>Internal search results pages</li> </ol> <p><br /><strong>On PM:</strong> To consult with client findings as needed.</p>

(G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write keep in the New column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write keep in the New Meta Description column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding noindex pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>As soon as we have hosting/cPanel access. <strong>For Shopify</strong>, please close this task right away. </span></p> <div align="left"> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Goal:</strong></span>  Create a backup in case someone goes wrong and we need to revert to the previous website version. We also use the site backup to create a test environment for development.<br /><br /></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions:</strong></span><br /><strong>ON PM: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Before assigning this task make sure the site access logins are in the workbook</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On  <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Link to the backup zip file on GDrive (containing all folders and database SQL)</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong></span> When FED shares a link to site backup in Google Drive. </p> <p><br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span></strong> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0</span></a> </p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Tutorial</strong></span><strong>: </strong>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clients live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clients CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clients live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clients CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, N/A.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only existing pages or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write keep in the New column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write keep in the New Meta Description column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding noindex pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Competitor Research &amp; Website Plan *C*
data.body: <p>When to open this task: Once keyword research has been approved by the client.</p> <p><br />Goal: Create a website plan for the client</p> <br /> <p>Instructions:<br /><br />On PM [1/2]</p> <ol> <li> <p>Comment on the task with the answers to the following questions and re-assign to IBM.</p> <ol> <li>Is this an ecommerce website?</li> <li> <p>What geographic area are they targeting/focusing on?</p> </li> <li>List any competitors they mentioned</li> <li> <p>Do they have a current website? If so, provide the URL</p> </li> <li> <p>Any other notes that would be helpful to the team, maybe pages they specifically mentioned they wanted, etc.<br /><br /></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p>On IBM </p> <ol> <li> <p>Create the website plan. Reference this document for instructions on how to do it: <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Sr7cw-mjoBP4H9Aq0e5xd-M7MEV56w0CgY2G5bo2mXQ/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Sr7cw-mjoBP4H9Aq0e5xd-M7MEV56w0CgY2G5bo2mXQ/edit?usp=sharing</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Enter the relevant information for the following tabs: Old Website Crawl, Old Website plan, and New Website Plan in the workbook based on the Pm's answers below. (i.e. no website = no website crawl tab, old website plan, etc.)      </p> </li> <li> <p>Based on the approved list of keywords from the client, please use this to strategize the website plan and fill in the target keyword column (column J) as well as additional keywords column K) for the respective page. </p> </li> </ol> <p><br />On PM [2/2]</p> <ol> <li> <p>Review the plan and make sure the suggested pages make sense based on your understanding of the clients business. Request edits or clarifications as required. </p> </li> <li> <p>Share the plan with the client, preferably on a screenshare. Make notes in column I and assign writing duties in column H. </p> <ol> <li> <p>Note: Detailed service &amp; products pages are extremely important for rankings! If the client would like Smartsites to write pages describing clients products or services, this is possible. However for the pages to be effective &amp; rank well, they need to be informative &amp; specific. We will still need detailed notes about the clients specific offerings.  </p> </li> </ol> </li> <li> <p>Once the client approves the Website Plan, task out webpage writing in the monthly content writing task &amp; assign hours in Monthly SEO Operations. </p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p>When to Close: Once the client has approved the website plan. <br /><br />Link to Manual: <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.trplmgcrueuc" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.trplmgcrueuc</a><br /><br />Link to Tutorial: TBD</p>

Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clients CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <p><strong>Mobile Speed Optimization *O*</strong></p> <br /> <p><strong>Goal:</strong><span> To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>On FED:</strong></p> <p><strong>Please always do these points:</strong></p> <p><span>- Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> <p><span>- Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> <p><span>- Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> <p><span>-Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> <br /> <p> </p> <p><strong>Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span>Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></li> <li><span>Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></li> <li><span>Implement Lazy loading</span></li> <li><span>Implement separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM to advise:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span>Please confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></li> <li><span>If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></li> <li><span>Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></li> <li><span>If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></li> </ol>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, N/A.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only existing pages or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write keep in the New column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write keep in the New Meta Description column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding noindex pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clients live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clients CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: New Website Content
data.body: <p>Hey <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span> <span>We are moving forward with writing the content for the Rolling Shutters project. The design spreadsheet has all of the designs in column D </span><span><span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zl_lrH3UdCyjfAS4jQrbmOlh1MZC0CQH8c-eJroigns/edit?gid=382424103#gid=382424103" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zl_lrH3UdCyjfAS4jQrbmOlh1MZC0CQH8c-eJroigns/edit?gid=382424103#gid=382424103</a></span></span><span>, which will outline all the necessary pages and where the content will be placed on the site. I have written in which pages will mimic certain layouts, but we need content for all of the pages laid out in the site structure aside from the blogs.</span></p> <p> </p> <h3><strong>Main Pages:</strong></h3> <ul> <li><strong>Home</strong></li> <li><strong>About Us</strong></li> </ul> <h3><strong>Services</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p><strong>Residential</strong></p> <ul> <li>Security Protection</li> <li>Blackout &amp; Privacy</li> <li>Extreme Weather Protection</li> <li>Sun and Heat Protection</li> <li>Outdoor TV Enclosures</li> <li>Noise Reduction</li> <li>Patio &amp; Outdoor Living Enclosures</li> <li>Energy Efficiency</li> <li>Vacation Home Security</li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><strong>Commercial</strong></p> <ul> <li>Commercial Security</li> <li>Storefront Protection</li> <li>Counter Shutters</li> <li>Dispensary/Pharmacy Security</li> <li>Kiosk and Bar Security</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <h3><strong>Shutter Features</strong></h3> <ul> <li> <p><strong>Motorized Shutters</strong></p> <ul> <li>Switch-Operated Shutters</li> <li>Remote-Operated Shutters</li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><strong>Manual Shutters</strong></p> <ul> <li>Spring-Loaded Shutters</li> <li>Wand-Operated Shutters</li> <li>Crank Box / Pull Strap Shutters</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <h3><strong>Resources</strong></h3> <ul> <li>FAQ</li> <li>Gallery</li> </ul> <p> </p> <p>Heres what you need to know for this project:</p> <ol> <li> <p><strong>Scope:</strong></p> <ul> <li>We need all pages written based on the structure outlined in the design spreadsheet.</li> <li>The content will highlight product benefits, features, and other relevant information to help create a comprehensive, informative site.</li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><strong>Reference Materials:</strong></p> <ul> <li>The client has provided several sources to pull information from, primarily from their manufacturers. Since these manufacturers are directly tied to the client, theres no risk of copyright issues. <ul> <li><a href="https://rollashield.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Roll-A-Shield</a> (Primary manufacturer)</li> <li><a href="https://rollac.com/products/rolling-shutters/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">RollaC</a></li> <li><a href="https://alutech.com/products" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Alutech</a> (Less preferred, use sparingly if necessary)</li> </ul> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><strong>Client Materials:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Attached is the Benefits of Rolling Shutters document, which contains the clients draft.</li> <li>The clients current site also contains content that can be referenced or repurposed where needed.</li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><strong>Background:</strong></p> <ul> <li>The prior project manager informed the client that we would handle this, but no content has been created yet. Well need to make sure we develop content that aligns with the provided materials and the design layout in a timely manner.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Action Items:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Review the design spreadsheet and attached materials.</li> <li>Pull content and structure it for each page as outlined.</li> <li>Where possible, enrich the content with details pulled from the manufacturer websites to create strong, persuasive pages.</li> </ul> <p>Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional guidance as you get started.</p> <p>Best,</p>

data.name: PM QA
data.body: <strong>Goal:</strong> PM to review the site and identify/task out any needed fixes.<br /><br /><strong>Checklist:</strong><br />1. Validation Errors look and feel (e.g. contact form thank you messages)<br />2. Social Media Icons link to the correct business profiles<br />3. Social Media Feeds link to the correct business profile (if applicable)<br />4. Check that all links in drop-down menu link to a page (not a template or empty page)<br />5. Check that all pages linked in the footer link to the appropriate page<br />6. If website has a newsletter, make sure emails are being added to the right list<br />7. For all contact forms, ensure that all drop downs are correct.<br />8. For all contact forms, when in a field press 'tab' and make sure it goes to the next field correctly.<br />9. Error Messages should be user-friendly (fields highlighted and explains what is missing)<br />10. Make sure there are no duplicate pages <span>(=same page with different URL; same content on multiple pages)<br /></span>11. Make sure no text is cut off (i.e. in banner, text boxes, image hover effects, etc.)<br />12. Make sure there are no "placeholder images' that should be replaced (<span>either ask the client for correct images; or choose yourself from depositphotos; or provide instructions for frontend to find)</span><br />13. if applicable, make sure that the navigation bar is sticky<br />14. Homepage and all subpages should have one h1(main heading)<br />15. All subpages should have breadcrumbs<br />16. Check site on mobile and tablet device<br />17. Check to make sure the site has a Privacy Policy and links to it from the footer<br />18. Make sure "Web Design By SmartSites" is in the footer for Custom Sites and "Web Development By Smartsites" is in the footer for Template sites.<br />19. Check if URLs match the URL structure per new website plan.<br /><br />

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontends optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clients live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clients CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>
