data.name: Backlink Health Check
data.body: <h2><strong>When to open this task?</strong></h2> <ul> <li>At the beginning of a campaign</li> <li>Task will auto-spawn quarterly </li> </ul> <h2> </h2> <h2><strong>Billable?</strong></h2> <p>Yes </p> <p> </p> <h2><strong>Important Notes/Considerations:</strong></h2> <p>IndexMeNow is a paid service, so we will only use this for links that are not indexed naturally after 3 months. This task will replace the previous task <strong>Broken Links Check</strong></p> <h2> </h2> <strong>Goal:</strong>  Maintain a healthy backlink profile for the client<br /><br /><strong>Instructions:</strong><strong><br /></strong><br /> <p><strong>On IBM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Proceed with filling out the broken links tab in the link building sheet &amp; advise next steps. </li> <li>Check for spammy backlinks to disavow &amp; advise next steps. </li> <li>Check for unindexed backlinks. Request Indexing via IndexMeNow if link was created longer than 3 months ago (i.e. since last Backlink Health Check). </li> <li>After the task is complete, update the <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1X7KV29YXwEZgO0_NbptPXrm1FLGLBP594Oup3__UvAM/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Master Linkbuilding List</a> with clients acquired links &amp; <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sZ6HVXME7KMM6uVx4gpmv-FkZclvuuy0E07-86QJRAw/edit#gid=1664165067" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Linkbuilding Blacklist</a> &amp; Greyist with unindexable backlinks.  <br /><br /></li> </ol> <p><strong>On PM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Review the list of broken links. </li> </ol> <ul> <li>For the tabs, broken internal links broken external links, and broken page with backlinks please task this out to the Frontend Team. </li> <li>If there are items found for the Lost Links tab, then task this out to the Inbound Marketing Team to get back.</li> </ul> Review spammy backlink list. Provide IBM feedback or approve to disavow.  Unindexable links will be refunded. Sometimes this is due to  3xx or 4xx issues which can be resolved by finding &amp; resubmitting the correct URL. Troubleshoot with IBM. After a second failed resubmission we will consider the link unindexable and IBM will add to Greylist or Blacklist as appropriate.  <br /><br /><strong>When to close this task (and any next steps)?</strong><br /> <ul> <li>Broken Links - FED &amp; IBM will confirm links have been resolved</li> <li>Spammy Links - IBM will provide screenshot of submitted disavow file. Google doesn't provide any further update on disavow submissions but will take care of it, so once submitted there is no further action needed.</li> <li>Unindexed Backlinks - IBM will provide screenshot of indexed backlinks. Refunded backlinks </li> <li>After resolving broken links, spammy backlinks &amp; unindexed backlinks &amp; IBM has updated the  <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1X7KV29YXwEZgO0_NbptPXrm1FLGLBP594Oup3__UvAM/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Master Linkbuilding List</a> &amp; <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sZ6HVXME7KMM6uVx4gpmv-FkZclvuuy0E07-86QJRAw/edit#gid=1664165067" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Linkbuilding Blacklist</a></li> </ul>

data.name: Set up DMARC, DKIM, and/or SPF
data.body: <h1><span class="task_name"><br /></span><br /><a title="Template Feedback" href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf-jbAAD0kJfaQg_uUMqGKbO2Q1pRGK_fxjN-roBCLvAtCPZQ/viewform?usp=sf_link&amp;entry.1264244551=null&amp;entry.340257621=2735&amp;entry.1854514229=null" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>*Open this task once we have received DNS hosting access.</strong></a></h1> <div class="rich_text"> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>Goal:</strong> Complete the necessary authentications to meet Google &amp; Yahoos <a href="https://www.klaviyo.com/marketing-resources/2024-google-yahoo-sender-requirements" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">bulk sender requirements</a>. </p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM: </strong>After DNS credentials have been logged in the workbook, assign this task to FED for the authentications you would like to complete. In your comment, make sure to include the clients website URL, Workbook link where credentials are logged, and specify the email address to be used in the rua tag for DMARC verification. </p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On FED: </strong>Follow the provided instructions for the domain authentications requested:</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>1. <a href="https://mxtoolbox.com/dmarc/details/how-to-setup-dmarc" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">DMARC</a></strong> - A protocol policy that servers use to make sure emails are from a legitimate sender. (This is required for all bulk senders as of February 2024)</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p>Instructions: Configure a DMARC policy on your root domain that contains the following:</p> <ul> <li> <p>v=DMARC1</p> </li> <li> <p>p=none</p> </li> <li> <p>Set an rua tag with a valid email address to receive DMARC reports (for example, rua=clienyname@clientdomain.com) or use web@smartsites.com</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>2. <a href="https://mxtoolbox.com/dmarc/dkim/setup/how-to-setup-dkim" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">DKIM</a></strong> - A protocol that contributes to DMARC compliance and allows a company to take responsibility for sent messages that can be verified by mailbox providers. (Optional)</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p>Instructions: Configure a DKIM policy on your root domain that contains the following:</p> <ul> <li> <p>Configure DKIM to Generate the Key Pair</p> </li> <li> <p>Create the Public Key as a TXT Record in the DNS Settings</p> </li> <li> <p>Generate and Save the DKIM-Signature</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>3. <a href="https://mxtoolbox.com/dmarc/spf/setup/how-to-setup-or-modify-spf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">SPF</a></strong> - When an email is sent claiming to be from your domain, the recipient server checks your SPF record to see if the sender is authorized to send on your behalf. If yes, the email receiver recognizes the message is from you and will choose to accept it based on your email reputation. (Optional)</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p>Instructions: To initiate SPF for your domain via your DNS hosting provider, follow these general guidelines:</p> <ul> <li> <p>Access your account</p> </li> <li> <p>At Domains drop-down menu, select your domain name (click Show All if your domain is not displayed)</p> </li> <li> <p>Under the DNS &amp; Zone Files menu, click Edit DNS Zone File</p> </li> <li> <p>Click + Add Row to create a new record</p> </li> <li> <p>Set the type to TXT and enter your SPF record in the right column (substitute your servers IP address where needed)</p> </li> <li> <p>Click Save to incorporate changes</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p>--</p> <p> </p> <p>Once confirmed, comment with the relevant information, and mark task complete. </p> </div>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontends optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>

data.name: Development QA
data.body: <p><strong>Goal:</strong> Identify and fix development issues.<br /><br /><strong>Checklist:</strong><br />1. Page URL verifications according to WB<br />2. 3xx<br />3. 4xx<br />4. 5xx<br />5. No Response Links<br />6. Missing H1<br />7. Multiple H1<br />8. Images over 100kb<br />9. Missing Alt Text in images<br />10. Missing Page titles<br />11. Missing Page descriptions<br />12. Necessary Plugins<br />13. Browser check (Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer)<br />14. Responsive check (Ipad, Iphone X, Galaxy S5, and responsive view in emulator)<br />15. 404 Page<br />16. Favicon<br />17. Robots.txt (Disallow in dev site)<br />18. Testing forms with dev email (devteam@melen.net)<br />19. Contact form Recipients<br />20. JSON-LD<br />21. Check the schema<br />22. Core Web Vitals:<span> </span><a href="https://web.dev/vitals/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://web.dev/vitals/</a></p> <div>a) Look at GSC CWV mobile issues</div> <div>b) Pick an issue (FID, LCP, CLS) that has a 'Poor' score</div> <div>c) Look at the grouped URLs and use the live PageSpeed Insights tool to implement changes and test</div> <div>d) Wait a week or so to see those changes reflected in the GSC report</div> <div>e) Repeat/adjust as needed</div> <p><br /><br /><strong>On PM: </strong>Once the dev site is approved by the client assign this task to the strategist. After strategist identifies fixes, please re-assign to the frontend team to fix.</p>

data.name: New Blog Post
data.body: <p>Hi <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> ,</p> <p> </p> <p>Can you post the following blog to the dev site.</p> <p> </p> <p>Does Pilonidal Cyst Surgery Leave A Scar?</p> <p> </p> <p>The gluteal cleft-lift procedure leaves a curvilinear, ('lazy 'S' shaped) scar which extends from the top of one gluteus muscle to the bottom tip of the tailbone.  Particularly for males, because we do not recommend depilatory therapy (hair removal) of any kind, we actually encourage full hair growth to obscure the scar.  More relevant to females, the scar is designed to be fully covered by the bottom part of a two-piece bathing suit.   Alternatively, for patients interested in neglible to minimal scarring, strong consideration should be given to our minimally invasive pilonidal treatment (MIPiT) protocol as a firstline approach.</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</p> <p> </p> <p>*****Please place "MIPiT" in same blue color and font choice as previous posts.  All mentions of the acronym throughout the blog should be aclickable link to my "pit-picking" treatment subpage</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p>Meta Description: <span>Learn about pilonidal cyst surgery and its scarring. The gluteal cleft-lift procedure leaves a curvilinear scar, while the minimally invasive MIPiT approach offers minimal scarring. Find out more about the options for a more discreet recovery.</span></p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p> </p>

data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clients live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clients CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Competitor Research &amp; Website Plan *C*
data.body: <p>When to open this task: Once keyword research has been approved by the client.</p> <p><br />Goal: Create a website plan for the client</p> <br /> <p>Instructions:<br /><br />On PM [1/2]</p> <ol> <li> <p>Comment on the task with the answers to the following questions and re-assign to IBM.</p> <ol> <li>Is this an ecommerce website?</li> <li> <p>What geographic area are they targeting/focusing on?</p> </li> <li>List any competitors they mentioned</li> <li> <p>Do they have a current website? If so, provide the URL</p> </li> <li> <p>Any other notes that would be helpful to the team, maybe pages they specifically mentioned they wanted, etc.<br /><br /></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p>On IBM </p> <ol> <li> <p>Create the website plan. Reference this document for instructions on how to do it: <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Sr7cw-mjoBP4H9Aq0e5xd-M7MEV56w0CgY2G5bo2mXQ/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Sr7cw-mjoBP4H9Aq0e5xd-M7MEV56w0CgY2G5bo2mXQ/edit?usp=sharing</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Enter the relevant information for the following tabs: Old Website Crawl, Old Website plan, and New Website Plan in the workbook based on the Pm's answers below. (i.e. no website = no website crawl tab, old website plan, etc.)      </p> </li> <li> <p>Based on the approved list of keywords from the client, please use this to strategize the website plan and fill in the target keyword column (column J) as well as additional keywords column K) for the respective page. </p> </li> </ol> <p><br />On PM [2/2]</p> <ol> <li> <p>Review the plan and make sure the suggested pages make sense based on your understanding of the clients business. Request edits or clarifications as required. </p> </li> <li> <p>Share the plan with the client, preferably on a screenshare. Make notes in column I and assign writing duties in column H. </p> <ol> <li> <p>Note: Detailed service &amp; products pages are extremely important for rankings! If the client would like Smartsites to write pages describing clients products or services, this is possible. However for the pages to be effective &amp; rank well, they need to be informative &amp; specific. We will still need detailed notes about the clients specific offerings.  </p> </li> </ol> </li> <li> <p>Once the client approves the Website Plan, task out webpage writing in the monthly content writing task &amp; assign hours in Monthly SEO Operations. </p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p>When to Close: Once the client has approved the website plan. <br /><br />Link to Manual: <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.trplmgcrueuc" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.trplmgcrueuc</a><br /><br />Link to Tutorial: TBD</p>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, N/A.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only existing pages or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write keep in the New column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write keep in the New Meta Description column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding noindex pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Development QA
data.body: <strong>Goal:</strong> Identify and fix development issues.<br /><br /><strong>Checklist:</strong><br />1. Page URL verifications according to WB<br />2. 3xx<br />3. 4xx<br />4. 5xx<br />5. No Response Links<br />6. Missing H1<br />7. Multiple H1<br />8. Images over 100kb<br />9. Missing Alt Text in images<br />10. Missing Page titles<br />11. Missing Page descriptions<br />12. Necessary Plugins<br />13. Browser check (Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer)<br />14. Responsive check (Ipad, Iphone X, Galaxy S5, and responsive view in emulator)<br />15. 404 Page<br />16. Favicon<br />17. Robots.txt (Disallow in dev site)<br />18. Testing forms with dev email (devteam@melen.net)<br />19. Contact form Recipients<br />20. JSON-LD<br />21. Check the schema<br />22. Core Web Vitals:<span> </span><a href="https://web.dev/vitals/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://web.dev/vitals/</a> <div>a) Look at GSC CWV mobile issues</div> <div>b) Pick an issue (FID, LCP, CLS) that has a 'Poor' score</div> <div>c) Look at the grouped URLs and use the live PageSpeed Insights tool to implement changes and test</div> <div>d) Wait a week or so to see those changes reflected in the GSC report</div> <div>e) Repeat/adjust as needed</div> <br /><br /><strong>On PM: </strong>Once the dev site is approved by the client assign this task to the strategist. After strategist identifies fixes, please re-assign to the frontend team to fix.

We also use the site backup to create a test environment for development.<br /><br /></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions:</strong></span><br /><strong>ON PM: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Before assigning this task make sure the site access logins are in the workbook</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On  <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Link to the backup zip file on GDrive (containing all folders and database SQL)</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong></span> When FED shares a link to site backup in Google Drive. </p> <p><br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span></strong> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0</span></a> </p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Tutorial</strong></span><strong>: </strong>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Set up DMARC, DKIM, and/or SPF
data.body: <p><strong>*Open this task once we have received DNS hosting access.</strong></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>Goal:</strong> Complete the necessary authentications to meet Google &amp; Yahoos <a href="https://www.klaviyo.com/marketing-resources/2024-google-yahoo-sender-requirements" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>bulk sender requirements</span></a>. </p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM: </strong>After DNS credentials have been logged in the workbook, assign this task to FED for the authentications you would like to complete. In your comment, make sure to include the clients website URL, Workbook link where credentials are logged, and specify the email address to be used in the rua tag for DMARC verification. </p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On FED: </strong>Follow the provided instructions for the domain authentications requested:</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>1. <a href="https://mxtoolbox.com/dmarc/details/how-to-setup-dmarc" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>DMARC</span></a></strong> - A protocol policy that servers use to make sure emails are from a legitimate sender. (This is required for all bulk senders as of February 2024)</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span>Instructions</span>: Configure a DMARC policy on your root domain that contains the following:</p> <ul> <li> <p>v=DMARC1</p> </li> <li> <p>p=none</p> </li> <li> <p>Set an rua tag with a valid email address to receive DMARC reports (for example, rua=clienyname@clientdomain.com) or use web@smartsites.com</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>2. <a href="https://mxtoolbox.com/dmarc/dkim/setup/how-to-setup-dkim" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>DKIM</span></a></strong> - A protocol that contributes to DMARC compliance and allows a company to take responsibility for sent messages that can be verified by mailbox providers. (Optional)</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span>Instructions</span>: Configure a DKIM policy on your root domain that contains the following:</p> <ul> <li> <p>Configure DKIM to Generate the Key Pair</p> </li> <li> <p>Create the Public Key as a TXT Record in the DNS Settings</p> </li> <li> <p>Generate and Save the DKIM-Signature</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>3. <a href="https://mxtoolbox.com/dmarc/spf/setup/how-to-setup-or-modify-spf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>SPF</span></a></strong> - When an email is sent claiming to be from your domain, the recipient server checks your SPF record to see if the sender is authorized to send on your behalf. If yes, the email receiver recognizes the message is from you and will choose to accept it based on your email reputation. (Optional)</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span>Instructions</span>: To initiate SPF for your domain via your DNS hosting provider, follow these general guidelines:</p> <ul> <li> <p>Access your account</p> </li> <li> <p>At Domains drop-down menu, select your domain name (click Show All if your domain is not displayed)</p> </li> <li> <p>Under the DNS &amp; Zone Files menu, click Edit DNS Zone File</p> </li> <li> <p>Click + Add Row to create a new record</p> </li> <li> <p>Set the type to TXT and enter your SPF record in the right column (substitute your servers IP address where needed)</p> </li> <li> <p>Click Save to incorporate changes</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p>--</p> <p> </p> <p>Once confirmed, comment with the relevant information, and mark task complete. </p>

Page URL verifications according to WB<br />2. 3xx<br />3. 4xx<br />4. 5xx<br />5. No Response Links<br />6. Missing H1<br />7. Multiple H1<br />8. Images over 100kb<br />9. Missing Alt Text in images<br />10. Missing Page titles<br />11. Missing Page descriptions<br />12. Necessary Plugins<br />13. Browser check (Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer)<br />14. Responsive check (Ipad, Iphone X, Galaxy S5, and responsive view in emulator)<br />15. 404 Page<br />16. Favicon<br />17. Robots.txt (Disallow in dev site)<br />18. Testing forms with dev email (devteam@melen.net)<br />19. Contact form Recipients<br />20. JSON-LD<br />21. Check the schema<br />22. Core Web Vitals: <a href="https://web.dev/vitals/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://web.dev/vitals/</a> <div>a) Look at GSC CWV mobile issues</div> <div>b) Pick an issue (FID, LCP, CLS) that has a 'Poor' score</div> <div>c) Look at the grouped URLs and use the live PageSpeed Insights tool to implement changes and test</div> <div>d) Wait a week or so to see those changes reflected in the GSC report</div> <div>e) Repeat/adjust as needed</div> <br /><br /><strong>On PM: </strong>Once the dev site is approved by the client assign this task to the strategist. After strategist identifies fixes, please re-assign to the frontend team to fix.

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, N/A.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only existing pages or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write keep in the New column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write keep in the New Meta Description column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding noindex pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Updating the homepage
data.body: <p> </p> <p><span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span> </p> <p>We need to fully update the client's homepage. It is very short and not very clear, and since their product is rather complicated/confusing to the general public we need to make this highly informative. </p> <p> </p> <p>First, I think we need to update the above the fold copy (H1 and H2). The client said something interesting that I think we can use here: </p> <blockquote> Google Analytics tells you the what. MightyRep tells you the Who, Why, Where, When, and How Long.</blockquote> <p>I think incorporating something like the above into the H1 could help visitors of the site figure out exactly what it is that MightyRep does. Then the H2 can clarify further, something about them being the premier lead generation service or something like that</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p>further down the page we need to add a section like "lead capture vs lead generation". This section will break down the differences and will express how "lead capture" is where the value is at, and is the service that the customer actually wants/needs for their business</p> <p> </p> <p>Another section needs to be about the use cases for MightyRep's product (i.e. who within the company will benefit? how?). There are 2 use cases: Marketing, and Sales. For the marketing use case/persona we will highlight how MightyRep can tell you exactly <strong>who the people are that are interested/attracted to your site/content. </strong> The sales use case/persona will highlight how MightyRep can help you <strong>engage with the people who visit the site. </strong>The sales persona would be a great way to highlight the demographic info that MightyRep can collect.</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p>If there are any other sections you feel need to be added, please do so. Right now, instead of creating the whole page, please put together a page outline so we can discuss. Also, please come up with 2 or 3 versions of the H1/H2. </p> <p> </p> <p>That was a lot! Please let me know if you have any questions. </p> <p> </p>

data.name: Website Maintenance - https://thepointeseniorliving.com/
data.body: <p>Please log relevant maintenance updates and questions in this task.</p> <h2>Checklist On FED:</h2> <p>One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.<span style="text-decoration: underline"> </span><a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed. <span style="text-decoration: underline"> </span><a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</p> </li> <li> <p>Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</p> </li> <li> <p>Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</p> </li> <li> <p>Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days.</p> </li> </ol> <p> </p> <p>Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</p> </li> <li> <p>Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</p> </li> <li> <p>Security Check (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</p> </li> </ol> <p>It includes the frontend parts of the website:<br />- Visual appearance of the web pages</p> <p>- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen) </p> <p>- Browser compatibility: <br />On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari) <br />On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</p> <p>- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</p> <p>- Broken pages/ layouts </p> <p>- Formatting or alignment issues</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Database Cleanup (Monthly)</p> <ol> <li> <p>Remove Unapproved comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Trashed posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Auto-draft posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Spam Comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Post Revisions</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata</p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <h2>On PM:</h2> <p> </p> <ol> <li> <p>Before opening this task, please fill in the proper GForm (i.e. (Re)Start, Website Launch, PM Transfer, etc.) that adds the relevant maintenance details to <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/2/d/19SDNRqoOmsifVDtslETR-M5l7HbCAjwRIJtkZ4i4yMo/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Website Maintenance Master Sheet</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> </ol>

rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Maintenance Cheat Sheet. </span></a></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.<br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <h2><span style="text-decoration: underline">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></h2> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed. </span><a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.  </span><a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Security Check (Weekly)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">It includes the frontend parts of the website:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">- Visual appearance of the web pages</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen) </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Browser compatibility:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari)</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Broken pages/ layouts </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Formatting or alignment issues</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Database Cleanup (Monthly)</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove Unapproved comments</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove Trashed posts</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove Auto-draft posts</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove Spam Comments</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Delete Post Revisions</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to close task (and any final steps)?</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">This task should only be closed when a client cancels maintenance services. </span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span></span></strong><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.bbicd8t2iv11" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.bbicd8t2iv11</span></a><span> </span></span></span></p>

data.name: Malware Cleaning *O*
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">:</span></strong> To clean malware from sites. This is a non-billable version of the task, to be used for clients who DO have maintenance services. </span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span></span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>When malware is suspected on the website <strong>and </strong>the client has a maintenance plan</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: underline"> </span></span></strong></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">I. On PM</span></strong></p> <ol> <li>Please list the website URL as well as any concerns/indicators as to why there might be malware on the site and assign this task to FED. <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Always use the high priority checkbox + 24hour label for the initial phase of this task.</span></li> <li>NOTE: Issues will not get fixed in search results right away after the malware is cleaned, this will need to be reviewed from Googles end. Usually GSC reviews the websites after submitting within 48 hrs, however, sometimes they take longer, and we can not control it from our end, since it is the process of the Google Services.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong>II. On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please scan the site with multiple tools to check the site for malware and clean any malicious activity. Once done please also check GSC to ensure no security issues are appearing on that end either.</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Checklist for  <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Clean the malware using the guide (</span><a href="https://github.com/smart-sites/developer-guides/blob/master/malware-cleanup.md" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: none">https://github.com/smart-sites/developer-guides/blob/master/malware-cleanup.md</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">).</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">1.1 Attach any reports of the tools from pt. 1 you used.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">1.2 Make note of any url patterns related to the malware, as these will be helpful for Malware Indexing Cleanup later. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">1.3 Launch GSC security check (it will take some time).</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Launch any  specific checks that were mentioned in the task and were not done in pt. </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">2.1 Review cron jobs.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">2.2 Review CMS admin/employee users.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">2.3 Change CMS passwords for all admin/employee users. Update in WB.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">2.4 Change hosting passwords (cpanel/FTP/etc). Update in WB.</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">III. On <span class="mention mention-user">Backend Dev Team</span> (in case the hosting is t35) *O*</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review SSH keys.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reset all running processes for the account.<br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Notes on the checklist</span></p> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">All points should be commented on the task. I.e. You removed some entity, changed password, or need to confirm the suspicious entity - comment everything for the client to know and future reference.</span></li> <li>Review entity means <ul> <li>Remove the malware entity</li> <li>List all other records for the client to confirm.</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span></span></p> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">If client has T35 Hosting - After Backend Team confirms all malware has been removed and no further action is needed. </span></li> <li>If client doesn't have T35 Hosting - After Frontend Team confirms all malware has been removed and no further action is needed.</li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span></span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.s07t6fmb4rzj" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.s07t6fmb4rzj</span></a></p>

data.name: WP Website Maintenance *O*
data.body: <p><span><strong>Goal: </strong></span>To setup a new maintenance project, and log relevant maintenance updates and questions in this task.</p> <h2><strong> </strong></h2> <h2><span><strong>When to open this task? </strong></span></h2> <h2>At the beginning of a maintenance engagement</h2> <h2><strong> </strong></h2> <h2>On PM:</h2> <ol> <li> <p>Before opening this task, please fill in the proper GForm (i.e. (Re)Start, Website Launch, PM Transfer, etc.) that adds the relevant maintenance details to <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/2/d/19SDNRqoOmsifVDtslETR-M5l7HbCAjwRIJtkZ4i4yMo/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>Website Maintenance Master Sheet</span></a>. For more details on beginning a maintenance engagement, please see the <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/18VtMHXoHQx9wHix2HFsy7QuGGbuN4A1vzhl_rdqd-jQ/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>Maintenance Cheat Sheet. </span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.<br /><br /></p> </li> </ol> <h2><span>On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></h2> <p>One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed. <a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.  <a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</p> </li> <li> <p>Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</p> </li> <li> <p>Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</p> </li> <li> <p>Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days.</p> </li> </ol> <p>Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</p> </li> <li> <p>Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</p> </li> <li> <p>Security Check (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</p> </li> </ol> <p><br />It includes the frontend parts of the website:<br />- Visual appearance of the web pages</p> <p>- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen) </p> <p>- Browser compatibility:<br />On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari)<br />On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</p> <p>- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</p> <p>- Broken pages/ layouts </p> <p>- Formatting or alignment issues</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Database Cleanup (Monthly)</p> <ol> <li> <p>Remove Unapproved comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Trashed posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Auto-draft posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Spam Comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Post Revisions</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata</p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span>When to close task (and any final steps)?</span></strong><strong> </strong><br />This task should only be closed when a client cancels maintenance services. </p> <p> </p> <p><strong><span>Link to Manual: </span></strong><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.bbicd8t2iv11" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.bbicd8t2iv11</a></p>

data.name: Connect Social Media Accounts to Website &amp; Listings
data.body: <p><strong>Goal: </strong>Add social icons and link social media pages on the clients website as well as any public listings that we can. </p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Adding Links to the Website</strong></span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>On PM for FED</strong></p> <ol> <li>Make sure we have access to clients website</li> <li>Tell FED where you would like the links on the site (footer or at the top is common)</li> <li>Provide FED with all platforms and profile links that need added<br /><br /></li> </ol> <p><strong>On FED: </strong></p> <ol> <li>Add all social links indicated by the social media manager to the clients website.</li> <li>Reassign back to the social media manager </li> </ol> <p><strong>Adding Links to Listings</strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>On PM for IBM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Make sure we have access the clients Google My Business listing and ask for Yelp logins if they have it</li> <li>Provide IBM with all platforms &amp; profile links that need added<br /><br /></li> </ol> <p><strong>On IBM: </strong></p> <ol> <li>Add all social links indicated by the social media manager to the clients GMB listing</li> <li>Identify any other live, public listings, including Yelp that we can add the social media links to and proceed with adding all social links to these listings</li> </ol>
